title: Britain set for first non-Thursday election since 1931, which could be good news for the Tories
text:
Britain is braced for its first non-Thursday election since 1931, which could be a good omen for the Tories.

The last time an election was held on a different day was 88 years ago, with the Conservatives winning 470 seats and the Labour party losing an astonishing 80 per cent of theirs after the Tuesday poll.

However, despite their poor performance, Labour's Ramsay MacDonald stayed on as Prime Minister, heading up a post-depression Government of national unity.

The coalition ultimately destroyed its leader's reputation, which has previously seen him renowned as the man responsible for Labour's extraordinary rise to Government in the 1920s, replacing the Liberals as England's main left of centre...
description: Britain is braced for its first non-Thursday election since 1931, which could be a good omen for the Tories.
